thomsonpy.data_management.octree package

Submodules

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.generate_octree module

It generates the octree needed for managing the electron density model in the solar imager.

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.nearest module

It checks the correct construction of the octree.

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree module

Main class of the octree data structure, it manages its structure and all its functionality.

class thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Data(coordinates, ne)

Bases: object

Class representing structured object for the Octree class thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Octree. It relates the electron density with a point in .

get_coordinates()

It gets the coordinates of the point represented by this Data object.

Returns

the coordinates of this Data object.

Return type

numpy.array([float, float, float])

get_ne()

It gets the electron density related with the point represented by this Data object.

Returns

the electron density of this Data object.

Return type

float

get_x()

It gets the coordinate of the point represented by this Data object.

Returns

the coordinate of this Data object.

Return type

float

get_y()

It gets the coordinate of the point represented by this Data object.

Returns

the coordinate of this Data object.

Return type

float

get_z()

It gets the coordinate of the point represented by this Data object.

Returns

the coordinate of this Data object.

Return type

float

class thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Node(level, ant, min, max, octree)

Bases: object

Node data structure for constructing the Octree (thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Octree). It contains points as Data (thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Data).

add(data)

It adds a new Data to the Octree.

Parameters

data (thomsonpy.data_mangement.octree.octree.Data) – new spatial Data to be added to the Octree.

contains(p)

It checks if this Node is containing the point p passed as parameter.

Parameters

p (numpy.array([float], [float], [float])) – a point in .

Returns

True if p is inside this Node, False otherwise.

Return type

boolean

get_data()

It gets the list of Data objects inside this Node.

Returns

the Data objects inside this

Return type

get_level()

It gets the depth level where this Node has been created in the internal Octree structure.

Returns

the depth level of this Node.

Return type

int

get_max()

It gets the maximum coordinates of the spatial region enclosed by this Node.

Returns

the maximum coordinates of the spatial region enclosed by this Node.

Return type

numpy.float([float][float][float])

get_min()

It gets the minimum coordinates of the spatial region enclosed by this Node.

Returns

the minimum coordinates of the spatial region enclosed by this Node.

Return type

numpy.array([float][float][float])

get_num_points()

It gets the number of points inside this Node

Returns

number of points inside this Node.

Return type

float

has_children()

It checks if this Node has children nodes.

Returns

True if it has children nodes created, False otherwise.

Return type

boolean

has_data()

It checks if this Node has any data stored.

Returns

True if it has data stored, False otherwise.

Return type

boolean

search(p)

It searchs for a specific point previously stored in the Octree data structure.

Parameters

p (numpy.array([float], [float], [float])) – point to be found with information about electron density .

Returns

a Data object representing the result of the searching process. If the search is successful, it returns the Data object related with the 3D point p passed as parameter, otherwise it returns a None object.

Return type

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Data

search_nearest(p)

It searchs for a specific point previously stored in the Octree data structure.

Parameters

p (numpy.array([float], [float], [float])) – point to be located for retrieving the nearest data information about electron density .

Returns

a Data object representing the result of the nearest searching process. If the search is successful, it returns the nearest Data object to the 3D point p passed as parameter, otherwise it returns a None object.

Return type

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Data

see_node()

It generates geometric structures for the open3D library for rendering the octree. It adds the geometric structures to the attrubute visual_nodes of the Octree data structure.

class thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Octree(level_limit, data_limit, data, min_v, max_v)

Bases: object

It manages the internal and root structure of an octree data structure.

get_data_limit()

It gets the data limit used as a restriction for the construction process. If this quantity of Data objects in a particular Node is reached and a new Data object is inserted in that Node, then that Node creates eight children if level_limit has not been reached yet.

Returns

the data_limit.

Return type

int

get_level_limit()

It gets the level limit used as a restriction for the construction process. If this level is reached the Node objects at this level do not create more children nodes anymore.

Returns

the level limit.

Return type

int

get_num_data()

It gets the number of Data objects stored in this Octree.

Returns

Return type

int

get_root()

It gets the root of this Octree from where the rest of the nodes are processed recursively.

Returns

the root Node of this Octree.

Return type

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Node

get_visual_octree()

It gets a list with all the geometric objects representing the internal structure of this Octree.

Returns

a list with geometric objects readable by the Open3D library.

Return type

list

static load(filename)

It loads an octree structure from a binary file.

static save(octree, filename)

It saves the octree structure in a binary file.

search(p)

It calls the search method from the root Node of this Octree.

See also

The method thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Node.search() using the recursivity to search for the p passed as parameter.

Returns

a Data object representing the result of the searching process. If the search is successful, it returns the Data object related with the 3D point p passed as parameter, otherwise it returns a None object.

Return type

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Data

search_nearest(p)

It calls the search_nearest method from the root Node of this Octree.

See also

The method thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Node.search_nearest() using the recursivity to search for the p passed as parameter.

Returns

a Data object representing the result of the nearest searching process. If the search is successful, it returns the nearest Data object to the 3D point p passed as parameter, otherwise it returns a None object.

Return type

thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Data
